channel.title: Stop a gfx? [ALLSTAR]
channel.description: I've added a dicing to my allstar 317, I tried to make a "Dicer Glow" it worked, but it doesn't stop if you leave the area, here's the code I have [code] if (diceZone() || playerIsMember == 1) { // DicerGlow stillgfx(247, absY, absX);[/code] so how would I go about making it so that if a dicer ( I used playerIsMember... ) isn't in diceZone, the gfx stops? sorry if this is common knowledge, I'm a pretty new coder.

item.title: Stop a gfx? [ALLSTAR]
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

It stopped people from logging in? I don’t know Allstar, but a possible cheap fix is find a gfx that does nothing but does not disconnect you and use that.

You should be able to create a new method i.e: public void stopGfx() {}, and have it set a load of default variables like this.stop(); stillgfx(0); etc. stuff like that.

Have a look at your methods and see what there is.

Read full topic

item.title: Stop a gfx? [ALLSTAR]
item.dc:creator: @Pwnerofppl Pwnerofppl
item.description:
@Pwnerofppl wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:2, topic:423440”]stillgfx(-1, absY, absX); ?

Are your absX and Ys the wrong way round?[/quote]
Odang I failed there, but -1 just auto stopped people from logging in, but thank you for pointing that out man…

Read full topic

item.title: Stop a gfx? [ALLSTAR]

item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

stillgfx(-1, absY, absX); ?

Are your absX and Ys the wrong way round?

I’ve added a dicing to my allstar 317, I tried to make a “Dicer Glow” it worked, but it doesn’t stop if you leave the area, here’s the code I have

if (diceZone() || playerIsMember == 1) { // DicerGlow stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
so how would I go about making it so that if a dicer ( I used playerIsMember… ) isn’t in diceZone, the gfx stops?
sorry if this is common knowledge, I’m a pretty new coder.
